All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ActorLoader
Class to load classes from a given jar file.
AuthenticationColour
The colors of doors and keys available in Chap's challenge.
BasicInput
Class for getting random artificial inputs
BoardPanel
class which renders the board and supplies functions to locate positions on the board.
Direction
Direction represents the direction a player can move.
Domain
The domain represents the internal state of the game.
DomainBuilder
Fluent Builder API for creating a Domain object.
DomainTests
 
EmptyState
The empty tile, which does nothing.
Enemy
This abstract class represents an enemy that moves in a predetermined path.
ExitLockState
Represents an exit lock, which acts as a wall.
ExitTile
Represents the exit tile.
fileLevel
A class for dealing with reading/writing files for level loading, saving and selecting
FreeTile
A Free tile is a tile that can store 'something'.
FreeTileState
FreeTileState is the internal state of a free tile.
Fuzz
Fuzz tests using randomly generated input
GUI
This class extends the Renderer's JFrame class and adds a menu and buttons to allow pausing, resuming, saving, loading, and rules displaying
Img
A class that allows access to the different sprites.
InformationState
This tile represents the information help tile.
InputGenerator
Class for generating input and playing the input
KeyState
Represents the key object on the board.
LockedDoorState
Represents a locked door.
Main
An executable class which starts the game
MainPersistency
Class to run the persistency mock for testing purposes.
MockPersistency
Class to create a mock of the persistency loading and saving files for testing purposes.
MockRecorder
The class to create mock tick input so we could create test the code we wrote, such as saving and loading.
Parser
Class to both load and save the level layout from or to xml files.
PersistencyTests
Class to store all tests for the persistency module.
pingTimer
This class creates a timer that calls ping() every 200ms And resets the level if the player runs out of time on the current level
Player
Represents the player on the game.
Point
Point represents a 2D point.
Printable
A common class for retrieving important data about a tile.
Recorder
The Recorder class, the place where every other class will access Recorder/Replay functions/methods.
RecordReader
This is the class we will be using to read the saved xml files.
RecordWriter
This is the class we will be using to write (save) xml files
Renderer
sets up the GUI and regins rendering.
ReplayGui
This class is similar to the APP GUI, and the structure of it is based around it.
ReplayListener
This class listens to player input for the replay and does actions based on that.
ReplayTimer
The replay timer class, this extends the Timer class.
SoundEffects
A class that allows the ability to play audio.
TestRender
main class that tests renderer components
Tile
Tile represents a tile on the game board.
TitleScreen
 
TreasureState
TreasureState represents treasure.
TriConsumer<A,B,C>
A consumer which takes in 3 parameters and does something to them.
UserListener
This class listens and reacts to keypresses of the user
WallTile
WallTile represents a wall tile.
